security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and scaffolding framework for security engineering workflows. The three Python scripts (threat_modeler.py, security_auditor.py, pentest_automator.py) are scaffold templates that validate user-specified paths and generate reports. All static findings are false positives: the 'Ruby/shell backtick' detections are markdown code blocks in documentation files, not actual command execution; 'weak cryptographic algorithm' flags are metadata and documentation references, not cryptographic code; 'C2 keywords' is a false flag on metadata fields. No network calls, credential exfiltration, or dangerous execution patterns exist in the codebase.

content.value_statement: Security teams need systematic approaches to identify vulnerabilities, design secure architectures, and validate defenses. This skill provides automated tooling for threat modeling, penetration testing workflows, and security architecture reviews with best practice guidance.
actual_capabilities: Run threat modeling analysis on project codebases with automated scaffolding
Execute security audits with configurable analysis depth and reporting
Generate penetration testing workflows following industry methodologies
Apply security architecture patterns from reference documentation
Implement cryptography following best practice guidelines
Produce structured security reports in JSON format
limitations: Scripts provide framework templates; actual security logic requires custom implementation
No built-in vulnerability database or CVE integration
Does not execute live penetration tests against external systems
Limited to file-based analysis of provided code repositories

prompt_templates.title: Threat Model Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the senior-security skill to run threat_modeler.py on my project at [PATH]. Identify potential attack vectors and document mitigation strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Security Architecture Review

prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a penetration testing workflow using pentest_automator.py for the application at [PATH]. Include reconnaissance, enumeration, and exploitation phases.

prompt_templates.title: Crypto Implementation Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the cryptography_implementation.md reference from senior-security. Suggest appropriate encryption approaches for [USE CASE] with code examples.

output_examples.input: Run security analysis on my authentication module at ./src/auth/
Generate a penetration testing workflow for my web application
What security architecture patterns should I use for a microservices system?
output: Zero Trust Architecture: Verify every request regardless of origin
Defense in Depth: Layer security controls at each level
API Gateway Pattern: Centralized authentication and rate limiting
Circuit Breaker Pattern: Prevent cascade failures
Secrets Management: Use vault solutions for credentials

best_practices: Run security analysis on every code change before deployment
Document all security decisions and architecture choices
Keep encryption libraries and dependencies updated to latest versions
anti_patterns: Storing credentials or secrets directly in source code
Skipping input validation on user-facing endpoints
Using deprecated cryptographic algorithms like MD5 or SHA1

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install via npx claude-code-templates@latest --agent senior-security.

faq.question: Does this skill perform live penetration testing?
faq.answer: No. The pentest_automator.py script generates testing workflows and guidance. Actual testing requires manual execution or external tools.

faq.question: Can I customize the analysis rules?
faq.answer: Yes. The Python scripts are scaffold templates. Modify the analyze() method in each script to implement custom security checks.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All analysis runs locally on your machine. The scripts only write output files you explicitly specify with --output.

faq.question: What languages can this skill analyze?
faq.answer: The framework supports any language with file-based analysis. Reference docs cover TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Swift, and Kotlin.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial SAST tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides lightweight scaffolding for security workflows. Commercial tools like Snyk or Veracode offer deeper analysis but require paid subscriptions.
